did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Scrapbooks of printed brochures, plans, and photographs of McAvoy projects, and similar loose items.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: During the 1930s Daniel McAvoy was a consultant for the Federal government on refinancing home mortgages. He served as secretary of the Home Mortgage Advisory Board and the national Smaller Business Council. He and his brother, Charles F. McAvoy, built homes in Forest Hills, Queens, and the Five Towns area of Nassau County, New York in the first decade of the 1900s. In 1948 he opened his own office in New York City as a broker, appraiser, and housing consultant, and was a pioneer in the development of prefabricated housing units.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks of printed brochures, plans, and photographs of McAvoy projects, and similar loose items.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Daniel Edward McAvoy. Papers, #2834. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Collection consists of a single box. Online guide unavailable.
